definition: howling wind and torrential rain (idiom)/(fig.) difficult, dangerous situation
to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet

sentences.english: In the raging storm the ship's masts were carried away.
sentences.chinese: 在狂風暴雨中，船桅被颳走了。

sentences.english: Through the long nights of angry weather.
sentences.chinese: 在狂風暴雨的漫漫長夜中。

sentences.english: He proceeded to talk up a storm.
sentences.chinese: 接着他如狂風暴雨般大談特談了一通。

sentences.english: The sailors cheated death in the stormy seas.
sentences.chinese: 海員們從狂風暴雨的大海中死裏逃生。

sentences.english: My big trees were plucked up by the storm last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨夜那陣狂風暴雨把許多大樹連根拔了起來。

sentences.english: Stormy weather, JAC Yantie transit so that, unfortunately, Guan Chuan ditch was lost in the Han River.
sentences.chinese: 狂風暴雨之中，江淮鹽鐵轉運使官船不幸在邗溝覆沒。

sentences.english: The ship can weather the furious storm.
sentences.chinese: 這條船禁得起狂風暴雨的襲擊。

sentences.english: We could hear the bluster of the wind and rain.
sentences.chinese: 我們能聽到狂風暴雨的吹打聲。

sentences.english: The sky lightened after the severe storm.
sentences.chinese: 狂風暴雨之後天空變亮了。

sentences.english: I would hasten my escape from the windy storm and tempest.
sentences.chinese: 我必速速逃到避所，脫離狂風暴雨。
地震之後又是一陣狂風暴雨。

sentences.english: May you  unleash a storm of affection on your loved ones.
sentences.chinese: 願你將狂風暴雨般的情感傾注到你所愛的人身上。

sentences.english: On the return voyage the yacht capsized in a sudden squall.
sentences.chinese: 在返航途中游艇被突然襲來的狂風暴雨所傾覆。

sentences.english: The most intense high winds, rain and lightning lasted for about an hour, she said.
sentences.chinese: 狂風暴雨和電閃雷鳴持續了約一個小時。

sentences.english: A single thought of evil can cause gales, deluges, and tragic disasters.
sentences.chinese: 一念惡，天地會有狂風暴雨發生，造成災害。

sentences.english: They battled strong winds and heavy rains in their carriage.
sentences.chinese: 他們駕着馬車與狂風暴雨搏鬥。

definition: lit. windswept and battered by rain/to undergo hardship (idiom)
a downpour/rain bucketing down/fig. to be overwhelmed (with work or things to study)
lit. to drop from the sky (idiom)/fig. to appear unexpectedly/to arise abruptly/out of the blue/to drop into one's lap
lit. breeze is still, waves are quiet (idiom); tranquil environment/all is quiet/a dead calm (at sea)
wind and rain/the elements/trials and hardships
to camp/to pitch camp/stationed/quartered/Taiwan pr. [zha2 ying2]
to dash on bravely with no thought of personal safety (idiom); undaunted by dangers/regardless of perils
